channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US consulate in Chengdu officially shuts in retaliation for Houston closure
item.description: The American flag over the US consulate in the Chinese city of Chengdu was lowered at dawn on Monday, as the diplomatic mission officially closed amid worsening relations between Beijing and Washington.

item.title: See the streets in Chengdu after US consulate shut down
item.description: The US Consulate-General in the western Chinese city Chengdu has officially shut down. Beijing ordered the US to close the site days after Washington forced a Chinese consulate in Houtson to cease operations. CNN's David Culver reports.

item.title: US experts urge shutdown as Covid-19 deaths surge
item.description: Coronavirus deaths in the US topped 1,000 four days in a row last week amid ongoing debates on the return of school and mask mandates.

item.title: Analysis: Trump's team dodges virus blame while jobless benefit cuts loom
A North Korean coronavirus outbreak might be the biggest threat Kim Jong Un has ever faced
item.description: The ruling Kim dynasty of North Korea has for decades predicated their regime on the notion that only they can protect the Korean people from the outside world, be that capitalists, the United States or other hostile forces.

item.title: CNN Polls: Biden leads in three key states Trump won in 2016
Why did China choose the Chengdu consulate to retaliate?
item.description: China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has ordered the closure of the US consulate in Chengdu days after the US forced the Chinese consulate in Houston to cease operations. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

item.title: India's PM says the country's fight against Covid-19 has proven the world wrong
item.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has claimed that his country's response to the pandemic has defied global expectations.

item.title: Olivia de Havilland, star of 'Gone With the Wind,' dies at 104
item.description: Olivia de Havilland, a two-time Oscar winner and for decades the last surviving star of "Gone With the Wind," has died at age of 104, her publicist Lisa Goldberg told CNN.

item.title: Trump tosses hats to supporters, golfs without a mask
item.description: As coronavirus cases spike across the country, President Donald Trump greeted supporters without a mask and threw hats into the crowd near his club in Bedminster, New Jersey. CNN's Kristen Holmes reports this comes a day after golfing with NFL legend Brett Favre, also without a mask.

item.title: Protests erupted across the US this weekend as calls for racial justice continue to grow
item.description: Protests flared up across the country this weekend, two months after the police killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis catalyzed a nationwide reckoning over race and policing.

item.title: Australian state of Victoria sees worst day of pandemic so far
Traveling while Asian: 'I'm terrified of walking around looking like this'
item.description: "I hope we don't get sick from these Ch*nks."

item.title: Jury trials were meant to deliver justice. Covid-19 brought them to a halt
item.description: Kellie Meir has waited two years to see the man accused of causing her son's death face trial.

item.title: Republican governor: I didn't want to do a mask mandate, but I had to
item.description: Arkansas Gov. Asa Hutchinson (R) explains to CNN's Wolf Blitzer why he decided to implement a mask mandate in his state.

item.title: Latin America is battling one disaster as a mammoth recession looms
Why Fox News cut away from a White House press briefing
item.description: White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany played a video so violent that Fox News cut away. And a Trump campaign ad attacking Joe Biden warns of more mayhem. CNN's Michael Smerconish asks is this perception based on reality, or is this just another "summer of the shark"?

item.title: Trump is calling protesters who disagree with him terrorists. That's in line with the world's autocrats
item.description: Heavily armed, unidentifiable security agents dressed in camouflage have been snatching anti-racism protesters off the streets of Portland, Oregon, and bundling them into unmarked cars, with no clear justification. They're scenes you might expect to see in authoritarian countries, not in America.

item.title: National security analyst: This is one of the scariest things I've said on TV
item.description: Ahead of Attorney General Bill Barr's testimony before the House Judiciary Committee, CNN national security analyst Samantha Vinograd warns that "we can't trust the attorney general to be honest."

item.title: Poland leaves treaty aimed at preventing violence against women
item.description: Poland's decision to leave a European treaty aimed at combating violence against women has sparked criticism the day before the country said it would begin the withdrawal process.

item.title: Why the Netflix show 'Indian Matchmaking' is causing a stir
item.description: The new Netflix series "Indian Matchmaking" brings to light an ancient tradition that is still going on today.

item.title: How Black Lives Matter went from a hashtag to a global rallying cry
item.description: It began as a love letter to Black people in the wake of an unexpected verdict.

item.title: John Lewis to make final journey across Edmund Pettus Bridge in procession
item.description: The body of the late US Rep. John Lewis on Sunday will make the final journey across the famous bridge in Selma, Alabama, where he helped lead a march for voting rights in 1965.

item.title: Kansai Yamamoto, fashion designer, dies age 76
item.description: Acclaimed Japanese fashion designer Kansai Yamamoto has died. The announcement of his death, posted on the label's official Instagram account Monday, said Yamamoto passed away on July 21, 2020. He was 76 years old.

item.title: Flu and pneumonia shots may lower risk for Alzheimer's, studies find
item.description: It turns out that flu and pneumonia shots may be good for more than what their names suggest.

item.title: Professional poker player's burned body is found
item.description: Police in Michigan have identified the woman whose badly burned body was found in a state recreation area as Susie Zhao, a professional poker player. CNN affiliate WXYZ has the story.

item.title: A baby and two adults are killed when a small plane crashes in a Utah backyard
item.description: A small plane crashed in a suburban Salt Lake City neighborhood, killing at least three people, police said.

item.title: 'No proof,' Official defends Sweden's Covid-19 move as mortality numbers soar
item.description: Sweden's State Epidemiologist Anders Tegnell tells CNN's Christiane Amanpour that, despite the country's high mortality rate, the no-lockdown strategy has "served us very well."

item.title: British tourists disappointed by UK U-turn on travel corridor with Spain
item.description: British tourists have been left disappointed by a UK government decision that requires all people returning from Spain to self-isolate for 14 days.

item.title: Covid-19 will permanently change the world's economy
item.description: Covid-19 will leave a lasting imprint on the world economy, causing permanent changes and teaching important lessons.

item.title: Bill Gates has a message to Covid-19 conspiracy theorists
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates responds to the many conspiracy theories and widespread falsehoods online about him and the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19 forces LA Michelin Star restaurant Trois Mec to close
item.description: Trois Mec, which earned a Michelin Star in 2019, is the latest Los Angeles restaurant to throw in the white napkin after the pandemic destroyed its profits.

item.title: Hong Kong's vast $3.8 billion rain-tunnel network
item.description: Below the mountains that overlook Hong Kong's financial district, drainage engineer Alex Lau is ankle-deep in water flowing into a giant tunnel almost twice the height of a double-decker bus.

item.title: Fleetwood Mac founder Peter Green dies at 73
item.description: Fleetwood Mac co-founder and influential blues rock guitarist Peter Green has died at the age of 73, his family's legal representatives confirmed on Saturday.

item.title: England and Scotland went separate ways on Covid-19. It may lead to a full divorce.
Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson are officially Greek citizens
item.description: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson have a special reason to celebrate this week: they're both officially Greek citizens.

item.title: Graduate fashion designer accuses Balenciaga of appropriation
item.description: An up-and-coming fashion designer has accused Balenciaga of appropriating her work, alleging that the luxury label posted an image to social media strikingly similar to one in her portfolio, which it had requested to see.

item.title: This 'baby' Bugatti is a $68,000 kid's car
item.description: The Baby II is a scaled down Bugatti that can still go 42 mph. The little car is an homage to the one Ettore Bugatti built for his four-year-old son in 1926.

item.title: Thailand's beach resorts have reopened to domestic tourists. Here's where to go
item.description: For travelers around the world, visiting a tropical beach resort in Thailand feels like a far-off dream right now due to Covid-19 travel restrictions.

item.title: This punk band is made up entirely of robots
item.description: The One Love Machine band are a scrappy crew. They have an affinity for punk rock, and members of the band play the bass, drums and flute. Oh, and they're all robots. The band is made up of scrap metal animatronics, created from salvaged junk from scrapyards around Berlin. For creator of the band Kolja Kugler, it's all about giving new life to discarded objects.

item.title: Painting an airplane: Why every layer counts
item.description: Airlines are some of the most recognized brands in the world, and there's no better billboard for them than the fuselage of their own aircraft.

item.title: How McDonald's plans to enforce its new mask policy
item.description: McDonald's and Chipotle announced they would soon require customers to wear masks or other face coverings as cases of Covid-19 surge across the United States.

item.title: The pandemic's unlikely pet: Chickens
item.description: At the start of the coronavirus pandemic, the food supply in America was in question. Images of barren grocery store shelves, cleared out meat sections and empty freezer aisles littered the internet.

item.title: Huge black bear spotted relaxing in a pool
item.description: A woman in Virginia was delighted when a large black bear decided to take a nap in a kiddie pool she had in her backyard.

item.title: Chinese consulate in Houston closed following US order
item.description: The Chinese Consulate General in Houston has closed following Tuesday's order to do so after US officials alleged it was part of a larger Chinese espionage effort using diplomatic facilities around the US, a State Department spokesperson confirmed to CNN late Friday.

item.title: As US and China force consulates to close, the risk of missteps and spiraling tensions rises
item.description: For almost two decades after the establishment of the People's Republic of China, the only formal contact between Washington and Beijing was through occasional meetings in Geneva and Warsaw.

item.title: Pompeo addresses order to close China's Houston consulate
item.description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo addressed the United States' closure of the Chinese consulate in Houston, Texas, saying the US would "take actions that protect the American people, protect our security, our national security."

item.title: Trump's team dodges virus blame while jobless benefit cuts loom
item.description: • Analysis: Shocking scenes in US as Trump calls protesters who disagree with him terrorists

item.title: This is one of the biggest warning signs yet for Trump's campaign
item.description: Poll of the week: A new CNN/SSRS poll finds that former Vice President Joe Biden leads in the state of Florida by a 51% to 46% margin over President Donald Trump among registered voters.

item.title: New DNA study offers insight into trans-Atlantic slave trade
